p.s: Thank you for visiting our international student conference and thank you for allowing me to speak to you!
Today is about the future of globalization.
Today is about our future.
But let's start with the present first.
For a long time it was not even clear if this conference could take place because of the current crisis we are in.
A crisis, that is as bad as it is also because of globalization.
As Peter Daszak explains in his article a globalised network of travel and trade have accelerated the pace of pandemic emergence.
But it is not only the pace of a pandemic spreading.
It is the pace of so many more problems councouringconquering the world.
Just remember the terrorist attacks in Europe or think about the climate crisis we are currently facing.
The ice at the poles is melting, animals are dying and our planet is suffering under our own actions.
We are the ones responsible for what happens with and on our planet.
We are the ones responsible for the terrible living and working conditions in outsourced factorysfactories.
We are the ones responsible for languages beeingbeing endangered and the loss of diverse culture.
Why don't we act upon it?
Why does it seem like everybody cares more about brands and cheap prizesprices instead of sustainability and fair trade?
We hold the power of demand and reply.
Why does nobody really act on the climate change?
Why are plane tickets still cheaper than the ones for trains?
It is our future we were talking about.
The future of our own children.
Why aren't governments acting on this matters?
If we start to make drastic changschanges right now it is already late but maybe not totoo late.
Globalization does not only have these bad sides.
We need to use the food ones to fight the bad ones.
We need to make use of the shrinking of the world.
Governments need to work together closely and we wil be able to overcome the spreading problems.
Just like we worked together while developing a vaccine and made it accessableaccessible to other countries.
We need minimum wages that are defined by law in every country in the world.
And we need to appreciate and protect our diversity in language, cuisine and culture.

People are better connected nowadays than ever before we must not let people get frustrated with globalization because the new technology is a danger to their jobs or because everything is changing to quick.
Integrating and retraining them would be a way to prevent the rise of nationalism and xenophobia.
Trying to cut ourselves and our countries out is not an option.
We can see it in Britain.
Thanks to Brexit the supermarket shelves are empty now.
No, globalization brings so many opportunitiesoportunities and enrichtments, that need to be supportetsupported.
But without fighting againsagainst the bad ones it's future will not look like we wish.
Our future will not look like we wish.
